August 26, 2003 - Cyebye.com agreed to pay New York state $10,000 in penalties, keep records of its activities and stop using other companies' names in its marketing without permission. The company also reached a preliminary settlement with Amazon for an unspecified sum.

t: The 5 Most Spoofed Brands in the World | Terranova Security

t: Pukemark, Sweatyrocks, Demonlick: Made-for-Amazon Brand Names Are Getting Ridiculously Surreal
s: October 14, 2020 - I was recently shopping for clothes on Amazon when I noticed bizarre brand names popping up—more bizarre than usual, I mean. It’s common to come across unfamiliar brands on Amazon, where sellers are constantly fashioning product lines and whole brands around what shoppers are searching for.

t: Report a scam - Amazon Customer Service
s: We take fraud, scam, phishing and spoofing attempts seriously. If you receive a correspondence you think may not be from Amazon, report it immediately.

t: Phishing Attack Blends Spoofed Amazon Order and Fraudulent Customer Service Agents
s: October 17, 2023 - It's the latest in a series of clever brand impersonation scams that use multiple vectors to lure victims. ... A new multistage phishing campaign spoofs Amazon's order notification page and includes a phony customer service voice number where the attackers request the victim's credit card details ...

t: Amazon Transparency: Counterfeit and brand protection
s: If you meet all eligibility requirements, enroll your brand in the Transparency program. Use the same credentials you use to log in to the Brand Registry portal. If your brand is already enrolled, log in to the Transparency portal to enroll products and add users to your account.
